intro: Danthonia collina, commonly known as narrowleaf hairgrass, is a perennial grass species native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows, woodlands, and along stream banks. Danthonia collina is valued for its ornamental appeal and its ability to stabilize soil in erosion-prone areas.
